docs.snippet: THESE novels have a number of things in common, not least the national obsession with sex and politics. Washington is the scene of John  Ehrlichman's "The Whole Truth" and Gwen Davis's "Ladies in Waiting," and the backdrop of Leslie Waller's "The...
docs.lead_paragraph: THESE novels have a number of things in common, not least the national obsession with sex and politics. Washington is the scene of John Ehrlichman's "The Whole Truth" and Gwen Davis's "Ladies in Waiting," and the backdrop of Leslie Waller's "The Brave and the Free." And all three purport to be stories about how America works.
docs.abstract: Waller, Leslie: The Brave and the Free reviewed by Abigail McCarthy (S)

headline.main: Washington the Scene and Backdrop; Wash. D.C. Author's Query

docs.snippet: LOS ANGELES--A few moths ago, I received some clippings of interviews with a former Federal intelligence agency official. That operative, Jesse Leaf, had been involved with the agency's activities in Iran, and well into the stories Mr. Leaf made some...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES--A few moths ago, I received some clippings of interviews with a former Federal intelligence agency official. That operative, Jesse Leaf, had been involved with the agency's activities in Iran, and well into the stories Mr. Leaf made some damning accusations.
docs.abstract: A J Langguth article on his unsuccessful attempts at finding former CIA agent Manuel Hevia Cosculluela in Cuba; Langguth was informed during a recent visit to Cuba that Hevia Cosculluela was out of country; drawing

docs.snippet: The British pound soared in foreign exchange trading yesterday on news of more stringent credit measures in Britain, while the dollar eased in New York after one bank lowered its key interest rate--perhaps indicating credit loosening.
docs.lead_paragraph: The British pound soared in foreign exchange trading yesterday on news of more stringent credit measures in Britain, while the dollar eased in New York after one bank lowered its key interest rate--perhaps indicating credit loosening.

headline.main: CURRENCY MARKETS Pound Climbs Sharply; Dollar and Gold Ease; Foreign Exchange

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 22 (Reuters)-- President Carter said today that he would nominate Lyle F. Lane to be Ambassador to Uruguay. Mr Lane, principal officer of the American Interest Section in Havana since 1977, will replace Lawrence A. Pezullo, who has...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 22 (Reuters)-- President Carter said today that he would nominate Lyle F. Lane to be Ambassador to Uruguay. Mr Lane, principal officer of the American Interest Section in Havana since 1977, will replace Lawrence A. Pezullo, who has been appointed envoy to Nicaragua.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 23--The Organization of American States called today for the "immediate and definitive replacement" in Nicaragua of President Anastasio Somoza Debayle's regime by a broadly based democratic government.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 23--The Organization of American States called today for the "immediate and definitive replacement" in Nicaragua of President Anastasio Somoza Debayle's regime by a broadly based democratic government.
docs.abstract: Organization of American States calls for 'immediate and definitive replacement' in Nicaragua for Pros Anastasio Somoza Debayle's regime by a broadly based democratic government; 17 of 27 members, including US, vote for compromise resolution at concluding session of emergency meeting; Paraguay and Nicaragua vote against resolution; Guatemala, Honduras, El Salvador, Uruguay and Chile abstain; 3 members do not take part; US Deputy State Sec Warren M Christopher hails document; Government troops clear some rebel-held areas of Managua, but guerrillas reportedly capture town 30 miles to south, illus (M)

headline.main: O.A.S. MEASURE ASKS 'IMMEDIATE' OUSTER OF SOMOZA'S REGIME; COMPROMISE IS PASSED 17 TO 2 Spokesman for Nicaraguan Rebels Denies a Washington Charge That Cubans Aid His Side
